job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description:
Job Description: Our work depends on a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) joining our team to support the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) activities in Columbia, MD. As an SRE supporting CMS, the candidate will be trusted to work on the development, analysis and use of monitoring tools and data visualization from multiple sources to proactively ensure the day-to-day Enterprise Portal infrastructure health in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud environment and on physical data centers.
Job Responsibilities:
Supporting Portal 24/7 operations, and providing on-call support as needed
Troubleshooting anomalies as part of Portal system reliability
Integrating new data sources to enhance the Portal infrastructure monitoring tool
Supporting the development of new visual aids and enhancing existing visual aids to improve early detection of infrastructure anomalies
Improving the performance of existing and new monitoring tools
Supporting the troubleshooting activities to identify the root cause of infrastructure anomalies in a timely manner
Ensuring the system’s high availability
Maintaining required Service Level Agreements (SLA)
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, related field, or equivalent experience.
4+ years of experience supporting a 24x7 Internet-oriented production environment, preferably across multiple data centers, involving at least hundreds of servers
Proficiency in scripting with Python, Perl, or shell
Thorough understanding of fundamental internet protocols such as DNS, HTTP, and TCP
Proven experience in various website/infrastructure monitoring tools, such as Chartbeat, ExtraHop, NewRelic, Dynatrace and Splunk
Familiarity with common open-source infrastructure tools
Experience with common networking equipment (Cisco, Juniper, F5, etc.)
Strong understanding of networking protocols
Experience in fast paced Agile environments using Scrum/Kanban
Experience in DevOps and Continuous Integration/Continuous Development (CI/CD)
Preferred Qualifications:
AWS experience using AWS FedRamp
AWS System Administration certification(s)
SAFe certification(s)
CMS or Health Care Industry experience
Experience utilizing Scrum/Kanban methodologies
Experience using JIRA
Proven oral and written skills to communicate with external and internal stakeholders effectively
